page.title: 19TRAFFIC IN SHIPSTON
page.content: The main road from Southampton and Oxford to Birmingham and the West Midlands, the{A34,}passes through Shipston-on-Stour.It brings lorries carrying car components and,in the summer,many tourists in cars and coaches. In our survey of{traffic}in Shipston, the traffic volume on the A34 at 2.00 p.m. was 514 vehicles per hour.Of these,71% were cars,26% were lorries or vans,1% were coaches,1% were motor cycles,1/2% were buses and 1/2% were tractors. St Edmund's Church, the Library and some shops are on the east side of the road and most of the houses are on the west side.Shipston has no{pedestrian {crossing.}80% of those interviewed said that Shipston needed one.
